sentence.Network_en: He had been before in drawing - rooms hung with red damask, with pictures'of the Italian school '.

sentence.Network_en: My heart is of frailthy, my pale skin damask.

sentence.Network_en: His furniture is all damask, including the cupboards in the kitchen.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Damaske, early form of the name of Damascus, where the fabric was first produced

entry.def: Damask is a type of heavy cloth with a pattern woven into it.

means.word_mean: 1. a table linen made from linen damask
2. a fabric of linen or cotton or silk or wool with a reversible pattern woven into it
